meanings.definition: To recentrifuge: to subject to centrifugal force again.
meanings.sent1: After the experiment, they had to recentrifuge the liquid to separate the components.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician recentrifuged the blood sample to analyze it further.
meanings.sent3: The scientist accidentally spilled the solution, so he had to recentrifuge it to salvage the experiment.
meanings.sent4: The idea recentrifuged in his mind, clarifying the solution to the problem.
meanings.sent5: The washing machine recentrifuged the clothes, making them almost dry.

meanings.definition: Recentrifuged: subjected to centrifugal force again.
meanings.sent1: She recentrifuged the mixture to ensure proper separation of the substances.
meanings.sent2: The separated layers were recentrifuged to confirm the results.
meanings.sent3: The chef recentrifuged the sauce to intensify the flavors before serving.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts recentrifuged around the upcoming presentation, causing anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic recentrifuged the engine oil to remove any impurities.
